projects.title: String Art Printer
projects.description: Innovative mechanical system that creates art using a 3-way pick and place mechanism to stretch and position strings, creating intricate images and patterns through precise string placement.
projects.detailedDescription: This project represents a unique approach to creating art through mechanical precision. The system uses a sophisticated 3-way pick and place mechanism that can stretch and position individual strings with millimeter accuracy. The machine translates digital images into physical string art by calculating optimal string paths and tension points. Key innovations include custom servo controllers for precise string positioning, computer vision for quality control, and specialized algorithms for path optimization.
challenges: Optimizing path algorithms for complex images
outcomes: Successfully created 50+ unique string art pieces
Reduced creation time by 80% compared to manual methods

projects.title: Linear Actuator System
projects.description: Designed and manufactured a precision linear actuator featuring a threaded lead screw and ball bearing mechanism for accurate motion control in automated systems.
projects.detailedDescription: This precision linear actuator system was developed for applications requiring high accuracy and repeatability. The design features a custom threaded lead screw with precision ball bearings, achieving positioning accuracy within 0.01mm. The system includes integrated feedback sensors, custom motor controllers, and adaptive control algorithms. The actuator has been successfully deployed in multiple automated manufacturing systems.
challenges: Minimizing backlash in the drive system
Achieving consistent performance across temperature ranges
outcomes: Reduced system cost by 30% compared to commercial alternatives

projects.title: Marble Display Machine
projects.description: Interactive kinetic sculpture featuring marbles moving along precisely engineered tracks with timing mechanisms, LED matrix integration, and synchronized visual effects.
projects.detailedDescription: This interactive kinetic sculpture combines mechanical engineering with digital art to create mesmerizing visual displays. The system features multiple marble tracks with precision timing mechanisms, integrated LED matrices that respond to marble positions, and synchronized audio-visual effects. The machine can run autonomous programs or respond to user input, creating unique patterns and experiences each time.
challenges: Synchronizing marble timing with LED effects
outcomes: Integrated 500+ LED elements with real-time control

projects.title: Biomedical Materials Lab Research
projects.description: Development of novel testing protocols for additively manufactured biomaterials, including batch Bayesian optimization and automated analysis systems achieving 5X speed improvements.
projects.detailedDescription: This research project focused on revolutionizing how we test and optimize additively manufactured biomaterials. By implementing batch Bayesian optimization techniques and automated analysis systems, we achieved unprecedented efficiency improvements in materials testing. The work includes development of novel testing protocols, machine learning algorithms for property prediction, and automated characterization systems.
challenges: Optimizing testing protocols for additive materials
Implementing machine learning for property prediction
outcomes: Achieved 5X speed improvement in testing protocols

projects.title: Ti6Al4V Fatigue Research
projects.description: Comprehensive study on corrosion fatigue behavior of additively manufactured Ti6Al4V alloys, focusing on biomedical applications and surface treatments with published results.
projects.detailedDescription: This comprehensive research project investigated the corrosion fatigue behavior of additively manufactured Ti6Al4V alloys, specifically for biomedical implant applications. The study examined various surface treatments, manufacturing parameters, and environmental conditions to optimize material performance. Results have been published in leading materials science journals and contribute to improved biomedical implant design.

projects.title: Advanced Manufacturing Systems
projects.description: Multiple projects including titanium SPF process optimization, ergonomic roller seam welding tools, and CNC programming for miniaturized biomedical components.
projects.detailedDescription: This collection of advanced manufacturing projects encompasses process optimization, tool design, and precision machining for specialized applications. Key projects include titanium superplastic forming (SPF) process optimization that improved yield by 25%, development of ergonomic roller seam welding tools that reduced operator fatigue, and precision CNC programming for miniaturized biomedical components with tolerances under 10 microns.
challenges: Designing ergonomic tools for specialized applications
